chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Type
f1: R -> T
P: seq R

Goal:
SF_ly (SF_seq_f1 f1 P) = belast [seq f1 i | i <- P]

Premises:
Notation seq := list
SF_seq_f1 = fun (T : Type) (f1 : R -> T) (P : seq R) => {| SF_h := head 0 P; SF_t := pairmap (fun x y : R => (y, f1 x)) (head 0 P) (behead P) |} : forall T : Type, (R -> T) -> seq R -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope seq_scope]
*** [ R : Set ]
belast = fun (T : Type) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => [::] | h :: s0 => seq.belast h s0 end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
SF_ly = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => unzip2 (SF_t s) : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
map_comp : forall (T1 T2 T3 : Type) (f1 : T2 -> T3) (f2 : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq ssrfun.comp f1 f2 i | i <- s] = [seq f1 i | i <- [seq f2 i | i <- s]]
SF_map_ly : forall (f : ?T -> ?T0) (s : SF_seq), SF_ly (SF_map f s) = [seq f i | i <- SF_ly s] where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T0 : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
eq_in_map : forall (T1 : eqtype.Equality.type) (T2 : Type) (f1 f2 : eqtype.Equality.sort T1 -> T2) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T1)), {in s, ssrfun.eqfun f1 f2} < -> [seq f1 i | i <- s] = [seq f2 i | i <- s]
unzip2_snd : forall s : seq (?S * ?T), unzip2 s = [seq snd i | i <- s] where ?S : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
unzip1_fst : forall s : seq (?S * ?T), unzip1 s = [seq fst i | i <- s] where ?S : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
map_reshape : forall (T S : Type) (f : T -> S) (sh : seq nat) (s : seq T), [seq [seq f i | i <- i] | i <- reshape sh s] = reshape sh [seq f i | i <- s]
map_cat : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s1 s2 : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- s1 ++ s2] = [seq f i | i <- s1] ++ [seq f i | i <- s2]
behead_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), behead [seq f i | i <- s] = [seq f i | i <- behead s]
map_flatten : forall (S T : Type) (f : T -> S) (ss : seq (seq T)), [seq f i | i <- flatten ss] = [seq f y | x <- ss, y <- x]
filter_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (a : pred T2) (s : seq T1), [seq x <- [seq f i | i <- s] | a x] = [seq f i | i <- s & pred_of_simpl (preim f a) i]
map_take : forall (n0 : nat) (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- take n0 s] = take n0 [seq f i | i <- s]
map_mask : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (m : bitseq) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- mask m s] = mask m [seq f i | i <- s]
map_rot : forall (n0 : nat) (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- rot n0 s] = rot n0 [seq f i | i <- s]
map_rotr : forall (n0 : nat) (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- rotr n0 s] = rotr n0 [seq f i | i <- s]
map_drop : forall (n0 : nat) (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- drop n0 s] = drop n0 [seq f i | i <- s]
belast_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1) (x : T1), seq.belast (f x) [seq f i | i <- s] = [seq f i | i <- seq.belast x s]
map_cons : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (x : T1) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- x :: s] = f x :: [seq f i | i <- s]
map_pairmap : forall (f : ?T0 -> ?T1) (g : ?T -> ?T -> ?T0) (s : seq ?T) (x0 : ?T), [seq f i | i <- pairmap g x0 s] = pairmap (fun x y : ?T => f (g x y)) x0 s where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T0 : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T1 : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
pairmap_map : forall (f : ?T0 -> ?T0 -> ?T1) (g : ?T -> ?T0) (s : seq ?T) (x0 : ?T), pairmap f (g x0) [seq g i | i <- s] = pairmap (fun x y : ?T => f (g x) (g y)) x0 s where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T0 : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T1 : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
filter_flatten : forall (T : Type) (ss : seq (seq T)) (P : pred T), [seq x <- flatten ss | P x] = flatten [seq [seq x <- i | P x] | i <- ss]
pmap_filter : forall (aT rT : Type) (f : aT -> option rT) (g : rT -> aT), ssrfun.ocancel f g -> forall s : seq aT, [seq g i | i <- pmap f s] = [seq x <- s | f x]
map_allpairs : forall (S : Type) (T : S -> Type) (R R' : Type) (g : R' -> R) (f : forall x : S, T x -> R') (s : seq S) (t : forall x : S, seq (T x)), [seq g i | i <- [seq f x y | x <- s, y <- t x]] = [seq g (f x y) | x <- s, y <- t x]
allpairs_mapl : forall (S S' : Type) (T : S -> Type) (R : Type) (f : forall x : S, T x -> R) (g : S' -> S) (s : seq S') (t : forall x : S, seq (T x)), [seq f x y | x <- [seq g i | i <- s], y <- t x] = [seq f (g x) y | x <- s, y <- t (g x)]
allpairs_mapr : forall (S : Type) (T T' : S -> Type) (R : Type) (f : forall x : S, T x -> R) (g : forall x : S, T' x -> T x) (s : seq S) (t : forall x : S, seq (T' x)), [seq f x y | x <- s, y <- [seq g x i | i <- t x]] = [seq f x (g x y) | x <- s, y <- t x]
rev_flatten : forall (T : Type) (ss : seq (seq T)), rev (flatten ss) = flatten (rev [seq rev i | i <- ss])
SF_ly_surj : forall s s0 : SF_seq, s = s0 -> SF_ly s = SF_ly s0 where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_lx_ly_inj : forall s s0 : SF_seq, SF_lx s = SF_lx s0 -> SF_ly s = SF_ly s0 -> s = s0 where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
unzip1_belast : forall s : seq (?S * ?T), unzip1 (belast s) = belast (unzip1 s) where ?S : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
unzip2_belast : forall s : seq (?S * ?T), unzip2 (belast s) = belast (unzip2 s) where ?S : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_size_f1 : forall (f2 : R -> ?T) (P0 : seq R), SF_size (SF_seq_f1 f2 P0) = Init.Nat.pred (size P0) where ?T : [T : Type f1 : R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
